title: The Veil of Forgetting
description: Discover why we forget our true nature upon incarnating and how this 'veil' between conscious and unconscious mind was the pivotal innovation that made meaningful spiritual evolution possible. This path explores pre-veil existence, the purpose of forgetting, and methods for piercing the veil.

sections.markdown:
To understand the veil, we must first understand what existence was like without it. Ra describes an early phase of creation where third-density beings had full access to their unconscious mind—they remembered past lives, understood their connection to the Creator, and knew the nature of reality. There was no separation between conscious and unconscious mind.

This sounds ideal, but it created a profound problem: without forgetting, there was little motivation for growth.

sections.text: There was no third-density forgetting. There was no veil. The lessons of third density are predestined by the very nature of the vibratory rates experienced during this particular density and by the nature of the quantum jump to the vibratory experiences of fourth density.
sections.context: Ra describes the original condition of third density before the veil was introduced.

sections.markdown:
Before the veil, entities moved through third density with full conscious awareness of their cosmic nature. They knew they were the Creator. They remembered their previous incarnations. They understood that other-selves were also the Creator. They had access to far greater control over their body complexes.

Yet this very transparency created stagnation. Knowing everything, they had little drive to choose—and the Choice is the entire purpose of third density.

sections.text: There was little enough tendency for experience to polarize entities that entities repeated habitually the third-density cycles many times over. It was desired that the potential for polarization be made more available.
sections.context: Ra explains why the Logos sought a new approach—pre-veil conditions weren't producing polarization.

sections.markdown:
Ra uses a striking analogy: these pre-veil entities were like children born into wealth who have no reason to strive. When everything is provided and known, what motivation exists for effort? The connection to the Creator was like 'an umbilical cord'—total security, but no impetus for growth.

They could love—but without the darkness of forgetting, that love couldn't be chosen with the intensity that creates polarization.

sections.markdown:
Faced with the inefficiency of transparent existence, the Logos conducted what Ra calls a 'great experiment.' The innovation was simple in concept but profound in effect: a veil was placed between the conscious mind (the Matrix) and the unconscious mind (the Potentiator), creating separation where there had been unity.

This veil is not physical but metaphysical—a division within the mind complex itself.

sections.text: Well, the idea then was to create some type of veil between Matrix and Potentiator. Is this correct? Ra: I am Ra. This is correct.
sections.context: Ra confirms that the veil was intentionally placed between the conscious mind (Matrix) and the deep unconscious (Potentiator).

sections.markdown:
Before the veil, the conscious mind had full access to the unconscious—all memories, all knowledge, all connection to the Creator lay open. The veil created mystery. Suddenly, the conscious mind had to work, seek, and choose without certainty. Faith became possible because doubt was now real.

This seemingly simple change had revolutionary effects: for the first time, genuine polarization could occur.

sections.text: The Logos is aware of the nature of the third-density requirement for what you have called graduation. All the previous, if you would use this term, experiments, although resulting in many experiences, lacked what was considered the crucial ingredient; that is, polarization.
sections.context: Ra explains that polarization was the missing element that the veil was designed to create.
highlight: lacked what was considered the crucial ingredient

sections.markdown:
The experiment succeeded beyond expectation. With the veil in place, entities could genuinely choose between paths. The service-to-others path became possible because giving could be a true sacrifice—not knowing with certainty that all is one. The service-to-self path also became possible, as entities could genuinely believe in their separateness.

Interestingly, Ra notes that the first veiled experiments immediately produced both polarities. The veil created the conditions for meaningful choice.

sections.text: It is our perception that such conditions created the situation of a most pallid experiential nexus in which lessons were garnered with the relative speed of the turtle to the cheetah.
sections.context: Ra contrasts the slow evolution before the veil (turtle) with the accelerated growth possible after (cheetah).
highlight: speed of the turtle to the cheetah

options.explanation: Pre-veil entities had full consciousness—too much, in fact. They lacked the conditions for choice.
Ra explicitly states the experiments 'lacked what was considered the crucial ingredient; that is, polarization.'
Physical incarnation existed before the veil. The issue was metaphysical, not physical.
Free will existed but couldn't be exercised meaningfully without the contrast created by forgetting.

sections.markdown:
The veil conceals far more than past-life memories. Ra describes a comprehensive forgetting that affects mind, body, and spirit. We lose access to our deeper knowing, our ability to control bodily functions, our connection to dreams, and our direct awareness of the Creator within.

Understanding what is hidden helps us appreciate both the purpose of the veil and the value of piercing it.

sections.text: If one were to attempt to list those functions of mind most significant in that they might be of aid in polarization, one would need to begin with the faculty of visioning, envisioning, or far-seeing. Without the veil the mind was not caught in your illusory time.
sections.context: Ra explains that the veil locks us into linear time perception, where before we had access to far-seeing.
highlight: faculty of visioning, envisioning, or far-seeing
not caught in your illusory time

sections.markdown:
Before the veil, entities could see beyond the illusion of time. They had access to probable futures and past experiences without the linear constraints we experience. The veil creates our sense of being trapped in the present moment, unable to see what comes next.

This concealment of far-seeing is actually a gift: it makes each choice matter because we don't know its outcome with certainty.

sections.text: Prior to the great experiment a mind/body/spirit was capable of controlling the pressure of blood in the vein, the beating of the organ you call the heart, the intensity of the sensation known to you as pain, and all the functions now understood to be involuntary or unconscious.
sections.context: Ra describes how the veil concealed conscious control over bodily functions.
highlight: beating of the organ you call the heart
intensity of the sensation known to you as pain

sections.markdown:
The veiling of body functions is particularly interesting. Before the veil, entities could consciously control their heartbeat, blood pressure, and even pain response. This sounds advantageous, but it actually reduced catalyst. If you can simply turn off pain, physical experience loses much of its teaching power.

The veil made the body into a source of catalyst rather than merely a vehicle under conscious control.

sections.text: Also upon the list of significant veiled functions of the mind would be that of dreaming. The so-called dreaming contains a great deal which, if made available to the conscious mind and used, shall aid it in polarization to a great extent.
sections.context: Ra identifies dreaming as a major veiled function that can help pierce the veil when consciously worked with.
highlight: aid it in polarization to a great extent

sections.markdown:
Dreams became a doorway precisely because of the veil. Before the veil, there was no need for dreams—the unconscious was openly accessible. After the veil, dreams became one of the primary ways the unconscious communicates with the conscious mind.

Working with dreams is thus one of the most powerful tools for piercing the veil. The unconscious speaks nightly to those who learn to listen.

options.explanation: The opposite was true; before the veil, the body was under much more conscious control.

sections.markdown:
While the veil serves crucial purposes, it is also designed to be semi-permeable. Ra describes multiple methods for piercing the veil—not to eliminate it, but to retrieve useful information and connection while still maintaining the conditions for meaningful choice.

The tools for piercing the veil include dreams, meditation, polarized relationships, and the disciplines of the personality.

**A note on grounding:** Working with veil-piercing practices can bring up powerful unconscious material. Integration is as important as opening. Balance exploratory practices with grounding: time in nature, physical activity, loving relationships, and ordinary tasks. The goal is not to tear down the veil but to become more conscious within it while remaining functional and present in daily life.

sections.text: It was discovered, experientially and empirically, that there were as many ways to penetrate the veil as the imagination of mind/body/spirit complexes could provide. The desire of mind/body/spirit complexes to know that which was unknown drew to them the dreaming and the gradual opening to the seeker of all of the balancing mechanisms leading to adepthood.
sections.context: Ra describes how many methods of piercing the veil were discovered through experience rather than design.
highlight: as many ways to penetrate the veil as the imagination
desire to know that which was unknown

sections.markdown:
The veil was not designed with specific doorways—these were discovered by entities seeking to know themselves. The very act of seeking creates openings. This is why Ra emphasizes desire and faith: the intensity of our seeking determines how much the veil yields.

Among the discoveries: dreams reveal unconscious content; meditation quiets the conscious mind to hear deeper wisdom; relationships with polarized others accelerate growth dramatically.

sections.text: In general, we may say that by far the most vivid and even extravagant opportunities for the piercing of the veil are a result of the interaction of polarized entities.
sections.context: Ra reveals that relationships are the most powerful tool for piercing the veil.
highlight: most vivid and even extravagant opportunities

sections.markdown:
Relationships are the most powerful doorway through the veil. When two entities committed to the same polarity work together, they create what Ra calls the 'doubling effect'—their combined seeking is more than the sum of its parts. This is why group spiritual work and deep partnerships accelerate growth.

Ironically, the same mechanism that creates the veil—separation—also creates the most powerful tool for piercing it: the profound desire to reunite with other-selves.

sections.question: According to Ra, what provides the most 'vivid and extravagant opportunities' for piercing the veil?

options.explanation: While meditation helps, Ra specifically identifies relationship as the most powerful tool.
Intellectual study alone doesn't provide the 'most vivid' opportunities Ra describes.
Ra explicitly states 'by far the most vivid and even extravagant opportunities for the piercing of the veil are a result of the interaction of polarized entities.'

sections.markdown:
The veil makes faith necessary—and therefore valuable. Before the veil, there was no faith because there was no doubt. Now, to progress spiritually requires trusting what cannot be proven, choosing love without certainty that it will be returned, and seeking the Creator despite the apparent evidence of separation.

This faith, exercised in darkness, is what makes harvest possible.

sections.text: The faculty of faith or will needs to be understood, nourished, and developed in order to have an entity which seeks past the boundary of third density. Those entities which do not do their homework, be they ever so amiable, shall not cross.
sections.context: Ra explains why faith is essential for graduation—it's the capacity developed through working with the veil.

sections.markdown:
Faith is not belief in any particular doctrine but the will to continue seeking despite uncertainty. It's the commitment to choose love even when fear seems more rational. It's the decision to see the Creator in others despite their apparent flaws.

The veil creates the conditions where faith can be exercised. Without the darkness of forgetting, there would be no opportunity to develop this crucial faculty.

sections.text: Perhaps the most important and significant function that occurred due to the veiling of the mind from itself is not in itself a function of mind but rather is a product of the potential created by this veiling. This is the faculty of will or pure desire.
sections.context: Ra identifies will/desire as the most important product of the veil.
highlight: faculty of will or pure desire

sections.markdown:
Will and faith are interrelated: will is the desire to seek, faith is the trust that seeking will yield fruit. Both arise from the veil. Without forgetting, there would be no need for the intense desire to know, and no opportunity to trust in what cannot be seen.

This is why the veil, despite its challenges, is a gift. It creates the conditions for developing the very faculties needed for graduation.

sections.question: According to Ra, what is the 'most important and significant' product of the veiling process?

options.explanation: This is a negative path tool, not the most important product of the veil.

options.text: The faculty of will or pure desire
options.explanation: Ra explicitly states this is 'the most important and significant function that occurred due to the veiling.'
Densities existed before the veil. The veil's product is will/desire.
Forgetting is the mechanism, not the product. Will/desire is what forgetting creates.

sections.markdown:
**Practical Example: How Forgetting Serves Choice**

Consider Sarah, who has a deep intuition that she should leave her stable job to pursue meaningful work helping others. She doesn't know if it will succeed. She can't prove it's the right choice. Her family thinks she's foolish.

**If there were no veil:** Sarah would simply know that all paths lead to the Creator, that security and risk are equally illusory, and that her soul planned this choice before birth. With such certainty, the choice would carry no weight. She might make it casually—or not bother, knowing all outcomes are equally valid.

**With the veil:** Sarah must choose in darkness. She feels the pull toward service but cannot prove it's right. She must trust something she cannot see. She must exercise will despite uncertainty. She must have faith.

This is exactly what the veil was designed to create. Sarah's choice—to follow love into uncertainty—develops her faith and will far more powerfully than any amount of certain knowing could. The fear is real. The doubt is real. And so is her choice to act anyway.

If she stays in the stable job, she hasn't failed—she's simply delayed. The catalyst will return, perhaps in another form. The veil ensures she'll keep getting opportunities until she makes the choice her deeper self intended.

The forgetting isn't cruel. It's the condition that makes her choice meaningful.

completionReflection: You have explored the great experiment of the veil—the forgetting that makes faith necessary and choice meaningful. Remember: the veil is not a prison but a school. It creates the conditions for developing will and faith, the very faculties that allow us to graduate from this density. As you move through your days behind the veil, may you appreciate both the darkness and the growing light you bring to it, knowing that your seeking itself is success.
